statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 0 \\ 0 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ -5 \\ -5 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ -2 \\ 3 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -14 \\ -6 \\ -16 \\ -23 \end{array}\right] span or don't span \mathbb{R}^4.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 0 \\ 0 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ -5 \\ -5 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ -2 \\ 3 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -14 \\ -6 \\ -16 \\ -23 \end{array}\right] do not span \mathbb{R}^4.
